subject: Technology
title: Space Elevators: Science Fiction or Future?
description: A 60-second lesson on Space Elevators: Science Fiction or Future?.

hook.text: What if you could ride an elevator from Earth's surface straight to orbit? No rockets, no explosions.

buildup.text: A space elevator would be a cable anchored on Earth and extending to a counterweight beyond orbit.

discovery.text: Climbers would ascend the cable using electrical power. The cost per kilogram could drop 99% compared to rockets.

twist.text: No material strong enough to build the cable exists yet. Carbon nanotubes might work but can't be made at scale.

climax.text: Japan's Obayashi Corporation has announced plans to build one by 2050. Most engineers remain skeptical.

punchline.text: A space elevator is the craziest idea that might actually work someday.

quiz.question: What is the main obstacle to building a space elevator?
options: We don't know where to build it
No material strong enough for the cable exists yet
